guī
variant of 龜 |龟 [gui1]
вариант черепахи | черепаха [gui1]

龟龟		亀tortoise, turtle, rad. 213

purpleculture_info:
⿔
Ideographic: A turtle on its side with its shell to the right
purpleculture_examples:
龜趺 [ guī fū ]: pedestal in the form of a tortoise
龜兒子 [ guī ér zi ]: son of a turtle (vulgar)
heisig_chinese_memo: People start using tortoises to transport bound up sheafs and attach brooms to the back of them so they are sweeping up as they walk along.
Ru_trainchinese:
guī: (сущ) черепаха
guī: (ключ) черепаха
jūn: (графема) используется в слове 龟裂
qiū: (графема) используется в названии древнего государства 龟兹
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The tortoise is bound up in a glass cage but at least he has the electricity running and a heating lamp.
humanum_full_description_en:
The shape of a whole tortoise when viewed from the side or looking down on a golden inscription elephant, with the head, tail, feet, and armor of the tortoise. The original meaning is turtle. " Turtle " and " toad " shape similar, the difference is " turtle " a tail, hind legs for straight, " strider " no tail, hind legs folded back. In the Warring States Period, the Chu characters " tortoise " and " strider " have the same shape. It may also be confused with the word " Kun ", such as "Shanghai Bo Yi. "Jian Yi" Jane 24 "I am tired of Kun, but I don't tell you." Kun is the error of the tortoise. (Ji Xusheng)

Oracle is used as the original meaning to mean tortoise. "Collection" 9001 "use turtle", which means to use tortoise to divination. Also used as the name of the person, "Compilation" 7859: "Zhen Ku (Only) Tortoise Order". Bronze is used as the clan name. Tortoise Father Ding Jue: "Turtle Father Ding". Since tortoises generally live a long life, the ancients believed that they could communicate with the gods, so they used their armor for divination as tortoise divination.

"Said Wen": "Turtles are old. Those with outer bones and inner flesh. From it, the glans is the same as its head. The nature of heaven and earth has broad shoulders and no male; turtles and turtles and the like, regard it as male. Elephant foot and carapace Shape. All turtles belong to turtles. 𤕣, the ancient Chinese tortoise." Duan Yucai's note: "Liu Xiang said. The words of the tortoise are old. The words of the tortoise are long. The tortoise is thousands of years old and spiritual. It is a god for a hundred years. So we can distinguish good from bad."
humanum_short_description_en: A Jinwen is like a tortoise. Because tortoises generally live a long life, the ancients believed that they could communicate with the gods, so they used their armor for divination, which is tortoise divination.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文象側視或俯視全龜之形，龜之頭、尾、足、甲俱全。本義是龜。「龜」與「黽」字形相似，差別為「龜」有尾、後腿直伸，「黽」無尾、後腿回折。戰國楚文字「龜」與「黽」同形。又或與「昆」字混淆，如《上博一．緇衣》簡24「我昆既厭，不我告猶。」昆即龜之訛。(季旭昇)

　　甲骨文用作本義，表示龜。《合集》9001「用龜」，表示用龜來貞卜。又用作人名，《合集》7859：「貞隹(唯)龜令」。金文用作族氏名。龜父丁爵：「龜父丁」。由於龜一般長壽，古人認為能通神明，故用其甲於卜問，是為龜卜。

　　《說文》：「龜，舊也。外骨内肉者也。从它，龜頭與它頭同。天地之性，廣肩無雄；龜鼈之類，以它爲雄。象足甲尾之形。凡龜之屬皆从龜。𤕣，古文龜。」段玉裁注：「劉向曰。蓍之言耆。龜之言久。龜千歲而靈。蓍百年而神。以其長久，故能辨吉凶。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文象一隻烏龜。由於龜一般長壽，古人認為其能通神明，故用其甲於卜問，是為龜卜。

Original meaning 本义: Meaning turtle

English senses 英语理解: turtle or tortoise; cuckold

Usage example 用法举例: 烏龜 wū guī (tortoise)

Importance by frequency 常用频率: 99999

Shuowen 说文解字: 舊也外骨內肉者也從它龜頭與它頭同天地之性廣肩無雄龜鼈之類以它為雄象足甲尾之形凡龜之屬皆從龜
